guide.introduction_rendered:
Here are photographs of the discovery process for the Paper Robot Hand: http://www.flickr.com/photos/connors934/...

Relevant parts
  • File folder
  • Printer paper
  • Tape, clear adhesive
  • Drinking straw
Tools
  • Pencil or pen
  • Scissors
  • Stapler

lines.text: Shopping:
lines.text_raw: '''Shopping:'''

lines.text: Most of what you will need for supplies can be found in either the school, office supply store, or a supermarket.
lines.text_raw: Most of what you will need for supplies can be found in either the school, office supply store, or a supermarket.

lines.text: File folders, string or heavy thread, adhesive tape, straws, paper, pen or pencil
lines.text_raw: File folders, string or heavy thread, adhesive tape, straws, paper, pen or pencil

lines.text: Tools, pencils or pens, scissors,
lines.text_raw: Tools, pencils or pens, scissors,

lines.text: Information resources: Anatomy info of hands showing bones, tendons, muscles, nerves
lines.text_raw: Information resources: Anatomy info of hands showing bones, tendons, muscles, nerves

lines.text: Preparation:
lines.text_raw: '''Preparation:'''

lines.text: This video demonstrates the discovery process for the robot hand: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=phqYMupHn...
lines.text_raw: This video demonstrates the discovery process for the robot hand: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=phqYMupHn94

lines.text: The paper robot hand is included in Kathy Ceceri's Robotics book: http://www.amazon.com/Robotics-Discover-...
lines.text_raw: The paper robot hand is included in Kathy Ceceri's Robotics book: http://www.amazon.com/Robotics-Discover-Technology-Projects-Yourself/dp/1936749750/ref=la_B002MO1BRI_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1353089514&sr=1-2

lines.text: Aaron Dollar's research into prosthetics at Yale's Grab Lab is an influence on this project: http://www.eng.yale.edu/grablab/research...
lines.text_raw: Aaron Dollar's research into prosthetics at Yale's Grab Lab is an influence on this project: http://www.eng.yale.edu/grablab/research_prosthetics.html

lines.text: Build:
lines.text_raw: '''Build:'''

lines.text: During the build process, students will trace their hands on sections of card stock. If the file folders are cut into quarters, there should be plenty for four hands from one folder. Staple a half sheet of printer paper to each piece of file folder once the hands are traced. Cutting the paper and folder at the same time can be easier.
lines.text_raw: During the build process, students will trace their hands on sections of card stock. If the file folders are cut into quarters, there should be plenty for four hands from one folder. Staple a half sheet of printer paper to each piece of file folder once the hands are traced. Cutting the paper and folder at the same time can be easier.

lines.text: Taping the sections of hand on one side of the fingers as the hand is cut will help keep the paper and file folder together. Having multiple tape dispensers will be useful for this. It is also possible to staple the inside of the hand together, but this will leave metal staples in the hand area.
lines.text_raw: Taping the sections of hand on one side of the fingers as the hand is cut will help keep the paper and file folder together. Having multiple tape dispensers will be useful for this. It is also possible to staple the inside of the hand together, but this will leave metal staples in the hand area.

lines.text: When taping the straws down to the folder stock, it will be useful to have lots of tape dispensers, or to have students cut several 1.5 to 2 inch sections of tape and store them on the edge of the table.
lines.text_raw: When taping the straws down to the folder stock, it will be useful to have lots of tape dispensers, or to have students cut several 1.5 to 2 inch sections of tape and store them on the edge of the table.

lines.text: If each student has a needle and thread, it will be easier to string the fingers. Using dental floss might be a good approach, as it is fairly inexpensive, and a very durable thread.
lines.text_raw: If each student has a needle and thread, it will be easier to string the fingers. Using dental floss might be a good approach, as it is fairly inexpensive, and a very durable thread.

lines.text: Use:
Once the hands are made and functional, students can examine their operation. As the hand operates, they can look for ways to optimize the design.
lines.text_raw: Once the hands are made and functional, students can examine their operation. As the hand operates, they can look for ways to optimize the design.

lines.text: By adding a more rigid arm, they can move the controls.
lines.text_raw: By adding a more rigid arm, they can move the controls.

lines.text: Creating a video of the operation of the hand will help students to explain how it works. Students may also create a video explaining how they built the hand as part of their documentation.
lines.text_raw: Creating a video of the operation of the hand will help students to explain how it works. Students may also create a video explaining how they built the hand as part of their documentation.

lines.text: Project Extensions:
lines.text_raw: '''Project Extensions:'''

lines.text: Robust parts Substitute: rigid tubing, plastic report cover, wooden hand layer, fabric backing layer, zip ties instead of tape,
lines.text_raw: '''Robust parts''' Substitute: rigid tubing, plastic report cover, wooden hand layer, fabric backing layer, zip ties instead of tape,

lines.text: Motorized movement Use a dc motor, servo, or solenoid to move the finger strings. These can be controlled with a switching system developed separately.
lines.text_raw: '''Motorized movement''' Use a dc motor, servo, or solenoid to move the finger strings. These can be controlled with a switching system developed separately.

lines.text: 3D printed components Use a 3D printer to make the parts that make up the hand. These parts may need to be designed by students. They can collaborate to design, test and make the parts they need.
lines.text_raw: '''3D printed components''' Use a 3D printer to make the parts that make up the hand. These parts may need to be designed by students. They can collaborate to design, test and make the parts they need.

lines.text: Silicon coated hand In some variations of this project, the hand is coated with clear silicon. If students will be doing this, they should be careful to keep the strings clear of the liquid silicon. This process will also require that the silicon set overnight.
lines.text_raw: '''Silicon coated hand''' In some variations of this project, the hand is coated with clear silicon. If students will be doing this, they should be careful to keep the strings clear of the liquid silicon. This process will also require that the silicon set overnight.

lines.text: Programmable hand If using a motorized movement, it may be advisable to use a microcontroller to operate the fingers. An Arduino with a motor shield (or similar) for each hand would be needed.
lines.text_raw: '''Programmable hand''' If using a motorized movement, it may be advisable to use a microcontroller to operate the fingers. An Arduino with a motor shield (or similar) for each hand would be needed.

lines.text: Storage:
lines.text_raw: '''Storage:'''

lines.text: During the build of the project, students will have lots of little parts to keep track of. They can store these in bags, or paper envelopes. Interoffice mail envelopes would work fine, or make a folder by folding an 11" x 17" sheet of paper and stapling two of the edges. Make sure the bits don't fall out, fold the open edges before stapling.
lines.text_raw: During the build of the project, students will have lots of little parts to keep track of. They can store these in bags, or paper envelopes. Interoffice mail envelopes would work fine, or make a folder by folding an 11" x 17" sheet of paper and stapling two of the edges. Make sure the bits don't fall out, fold the open edges before stapling.

lines.text: Student pouches can be stored in a file drawer or an empty paper case box.
lines.text_raw: Student pouches can be stored in a file drawer or an empty paper case box.

lines.text: Once the hands are complete, they can be stored in a gallery case, or placed in a location where they can be used respectfully. Students should be allowed to take their hands home when the project is complete.
lines.text_raw: Once the hands are complete, they can be stored in a gallery case, or placed in a location where they can be used respectfully. Students should be allowed to take their hands home when the project is complete.

lines.text: Demonstrations:
lines.text_raw: '''Demonstrations:'''

lines.text: Students should be encouraged to show their hands off. A gallery showing of the projects may be valuable.
lines.text_raw: Students should be encouraged to show their hands off. A gallery showing of the projects may be valuable.

lines.text: Creating a video of the hands in operation while they are explained will give students a chance to reflect on their work.
lines.text_raw: Creating a video of the hands in operation while they are explained will give students a chance to reflect on their work.

guide.summary: This paper robot hand will introduce you and your students to several techniques in robotics while exploring anatomy through crafting materials.
